newsitem.title: USA: White House encouraged by Gingrich statement - Reed.
newsitem.headline: White House encouraged by Gingrich statement - Reed.

text.p: White House domestic policy adviser Bruce Reed on Tuesday said he was encouraged by indications that the Republicans may be showing signs of flexibility on the budget.

"We are always encouraged to see any sign of flexibility and compromise," he told a briefing for a small group of reporters when asked about a statement by House of Representatives Speaker Newt Gingrich endorsing putting off a drive for a major tax cut.
Reed said that he believed the new veto power would serve as a major deterrent to "pork barrel" legislation, since few lawmakers would like to see their project vetoed on the basis of being wasteful.
"I can assure you we will relish the first time," Reed told reporters, adding "Congress will be much less likely to include projects that are difficult to defend."
He said, however, that the veto power would largely be tied to appropriations bills and would "not affect the dynamic of these budget discussion we are having now."
But he added that budgets are going to be tight for the forseeable future, so the "prospects of loading the budget with pork were not very good anyway."
